title: Ukraine Offensive Will Push Through Winter, U.S. Defense Chief Says
description: The “deliberate cruelty” of Russia’s latest bombardment has made the West more determined to help Ukraine, Defense Secretary Lloyd J. Austin III said.

title: The 2022 Living Planet Index Is Out. Here’s How to Understand It.
description: The latest update to an important assessment found that populations had declined by an average of 69 percent since 1970. But that might not mean what you think.

title: Western Nations Rush Defensive Systems to Ukraine to Counter Russian Missiles
description: Even with Soviet-era defensive weapons, the Ukrainians have been more than holding their own, but this week’s barrage prompted calls to better equip them.

title: Your Thursday Briefing: China’s Covid Testing Problems
description: Plus President Biden’s security strategy and Myanmar cracks down on journalists.

title: Liz Truss Stirs Uncertainty Over the U.K.’s Economic Plans
description: Prime Minister Liz Truss appeared to rule out cuts in public spending, as doubts about the fiscal soundness of the government’s program continued to roil the markets.

title: Britain’s ‘Brexit Festival’ Is Under Investigation Over Cost
description: The festival, a series of exhibitions officially called “Unboxed: Creativity in the U.K.,” came to be known as the “Festival of Brexit.” It cost 120 million pounds.

title: In Long-Contested Move, Paris Makes Sacré-Coeur a Historical Monument
description: The basilica, which sits atop the hill of Montmartre, is the second most visited site in the capital, after Notre-Dame.

title: US Considers Easing Sanctions on Venezuela as Migration Surges
description: The Biden administration may allow the last American company producing oil in Venezuela to resume exports if the Maduro government takes steps to restore democracy.

title: Biden’s National Security Strategy Focuses on China, Russia and Democracy at Home
description: The document, which every new administration is required to issue, was delayed last winter as it became clear that Russia’s invasion of Ukraine was imminent.

title: Brittney Griner Is Struggling in Russian Prison, Her Lawyer Says
description: Facing nine years in prison in Russia, the U.S. basketball star is struggling emotionally and worried that a swap deal to release her may not materialize, according to one of her attorneys.

title: Russian Shellfire Cuts Power to Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Plant
description: The electricity supply was affected after Russian forces shelled a substation that provides power to the nuclear plant, Ukraine’s state energy company said.

title: Russia Arrests 8 People Over the Crimea Bridge Attack
description: Five are citizens of Russia, according to Russia’s domestic intelligence agency, the F.S.B., and the others are Ukrainian and Armenian.

title: Poland Says Druzhba Pipeline Leak Was Probably an Accident
description: News of the episode raised energy security concerns, but a Polish energy official said there was no reason to suspect sabotage.

title: A Republican Burden
description: Banning abortion is weighing on the party.

title: The ‘Age of P.C.R. Prosperity’? China’s Covid-Testing Strategy Comes Under Strain
description: Bills are piling up and infections are spreading, yet there are no signs that Beijing plans to rethink a cornerstone of its pandemic policy.

title: Does Korean Cuisine Belong to Korea?
description: South Korea has sought to protect and enshrine its national dishes — while also exporting its wonders to the world.

title: The E-Bike: The New Car Alternative
description: VanMoof, the Dutch e-bike company taking inspiration from Apple and Tesla, is one of the world’s hottest brands in a bike market remade by the pandemic. Will it help reshape urban transportation?

title: Read Your Way Through London
description: Bernardine Evaristo, whose “Girl, Woman, Other” won the Booker Prize, invites readers into London, a city whose rich literary landscape is “for everyone, not just the privileged few.”

title: Live Updates: Russia Says It Detained 8 Tied to Crimea Explosion
description: Russia blamed Ukraine’s military intelligence service for Saturday’s attack on a bridge. Ukraine’s government has not publicly claimed responsibility for the blast.

title: Protests in Iran Spread, Including to Oil Sector, Despite Violent Crackdown
description: Human rights groups say at least 185 people have been killed and thousands injured or arrested, but demonstrations that began after the death of Mahsa Amini have continued nearly a month.

title: Young, Underground Reporters ‘Fight a Gun With a Pen’ in Myanmar
description: The Southeast Asian nation has seen a relentless crackdown on free expression, with a small literary magazine emerging as one of the few remaining independent media outlets.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Calls for more weapons for Ukraine.

title: Some Ukrainians Brace for Possibility of Russian Nuclear Strike
description: Fears of more severe retaliation grew after the attack on Russia’s sole bridge to Crimea. But U.S. officials have said they think the chances of Moscow using nuclear weapons are low.
